meanings.definition: The act of lifting or gathering something up.
meanings.sent1: I helped my friend with the pickup of his heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: The pickup of toys from the floor made the room look tidy.
meanings.sent3: The pickup of fallen leaves turned into a fun game for the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her quick pickup of the situation saved the day.
meanings.sent5: The pickup of shells along the beach was a delightful activity.

meanings.definition: A small truck with an open bed for transporting goods.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used his pickup to carry the harvested crops.
meanings.sent2: We loaded the furniture onto the pickup for moving.
meanings.sent3: The pickup was so full of pumpkins, it looked like a giant orange basket.
meanings.sent4: The pickup roared down the road, carrying supplies for the camp.
meanings.sent5: The pickup's engine hummed as it transported the tools to the construction site.

meanings.definition: A casual sexual encounter or relationship.
meanings.sent1: She regretted the pickup at the party last night.
meanings.sent2: Their pickup at the bar led to a brief romance.
meanings.sent3: The pickup at the office holiday party was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: His pickup line was so cheesy, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The pickup between the characters added an unexpected twist to the story.

meanings.definition: A device that converts sound waves into electrical signals in a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The musician adjusted the pickup on his guitar for better sound quality.
meanings.sent2: The pickup on the electric keyboard enhanced the music performance.
meanings.sent3: The pickup on the violin malfunctioned during the concert, creating a funny sound.
meanings.sent4: Her new guitar had a pickup that produced a unique tone.
meanings.sent5: The pickup on the microphone captured every note of the singer's voice.
